title: C08-2010

sentences.text: Language resource quality is crucial in NLP .
Many of the resources used are derived from data created by human beings out of an NLP context , especially regarding MT and reference translations .
Indeed , automatic evaluations need high-quality data that allow the comparison of both automatic and human translations .
The validation of these resources is widely recommended before being used .
This paper describes the impact of using different-quality references on evaluation .
Surprisingly enough , similar scores are obtained in many cases regardless of the quality .
Thus , the limitations of the automatic metrics used within MT are also discussed in this regard .

summary: Language resource quality is crucial in NLP . Many of the resources used are derived from data created by human beings out of an NLP context , especially regarding MT and reference translations . Indeed , automatic evaluations need high-quality data that allow the comparison of both automatic and human translations . The validation of these resources is widely recommended before being used . This paper describes the impact of using different-quality references on evaluation . Surprisingly enough , similar scores are obtained in many cases regardless of the quality . Thus , the limitations of the automatic metrics used within MT are also discussed in this regard .

Predicate-quality_is_crucial_in.label: quality is crucial in
Predicate-quality_is_crucial_in.description: This predicate indicates that the quality of something (the subject) plays a vital or essential role in achieving or understanding the object. It highlights the significance and importance of the subject's quality in relation to the object, emphasizing its relevance and impact.

Predicate-is_crucial_in.label: is crucial in
Predicate-is_crucial_in.description: Indicates that the subject has a fundamental or essential role in achieving or understanding the object. The predicate highlights the significance of the subject in relation to the object, emphasizing its importance for the object's existence, functionality, or success.

Predicate-are_derived_from.label: are derived from
Predicate-are_derived_from.description: The predicate 'are derived from' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject's characteristics or properties are originated, developed, or have their roots in the object. In other words, it suggests that the subject has its foundation, inspiration, or basis in the object.

Predicate-need.label: need
Predicate-need.description: The predicate 'need' indicates a state of requirement or necessity between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject lacks something essential to its functioning, development, or well-being, which can be fulfilled by the object.

Predicate-used_within.label: used within
Predicate-used_within.description: The predicate 'used within' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g., automatic metrics) operates or functions within the scope of the object (e.g., MT). This connection suggests that the subject's purpose, function, or application is contained or bounded by the object. In general, this predicate implies a sense of containment, inclusion, or scope.

Predicate-have_an_impact_on.label: have an impact on
Predicate-have_an_impact_on.description: The predicate 'have an impact on' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject's presence or influence affects the state or outcome of the object. This connection implies a directional flow from the subject to the object, where the subject's characteristics, properties, or actions shape or alter the object in some way.

Predicate-allow_the_comparison.label: allow the comparison
Predicate-allow_the_comparison.description: To 'allow the comparison' means to permit or enable a connection between two entities (subject and object), typically in order to evaluate their similarity, equivalence, or difference. This predicate facilitates an analytical process that highlights distinct features or characteristics of both subject and object, fostering understanding through comparative analysis.

Predicate-are_used.label: are used
Predicate-are_used.description: The predicate 'are used' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject's elements or instances utilize or employ the object in some manner. This connection implies that the subject has a practical application, reliance, or utilization of the object to achieve a particular goal or function.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a more specific instance or concept within a larger category or domain defined by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject represents a narrower or more detailed aspect of the object.
